item.title: Amy add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "What refuge is there for the victim who is oppressed with the feeling that there are a thousand new books he ought to read, while life is only long enough for him to attempt to read a hundred?" -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Amy add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Amy add a quote by Richard de Bury
item.description: "[A]ll who are smitten with the love of books think cheaply of the world and wealth; as Jerome says to Vigilantius: The same man cannot love both gold and books... The hideousness of vice is greatly reprobated in books, so that he who loves to commune with books is lead to detest all manner of vice. The demon, who derives his name from knowledge, is most effectually defeated by the knowledge of books, and through books his multitudinous deceits and the endless labyrinths of his guile are laid bare to those who read..." -- Richard de Bury

item.title: Amy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Amy add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Amy add a quote by Lewis Mumford
item.description: "A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth is a poverty-stricken day; and a succession of such days is fatal to human life." -- Lewis Mumford

item.title: Amy add a quote by Richard de Bury
Amy add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Amy add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "Reading in bed is a self-centered act, immobile, free from ordinary social conventions, invisible to the world, and one that, because it takes place between the sheets, in the realm of lust and sinful idleness, has something of the thrill of things forbidden." -- Alberto Manguel

item.title: Amy add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Amy add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Amy add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Amy add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "The odd thing about people who had many books was how they always wanted more." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Amy add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Second hand books are wild books, homeless books; they have come together in vast flocks of variegated feather, and have a charm which the domesticated volumes of the library lack." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Amy add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you." -- Harold Bloom

item.title: Amy add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "Books may not change our suffering, books may not protect us from evil, books may not tell us what is good or what is beautiful, and they will certainly not shield us from the common fate of the grave. But books grant us myriad possibilities: the possibility of change, the possibility of illumination." -- Alberto Manguel

item.title: Amy add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Moral wounds have this peculiarity - they may be hidden, but they never close; always painful, always ready to bleed when touched, they remain fresh and open in the heart." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Amy add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "All human wisdom is contained in these two words--"Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Amy add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "For all evils there are two remedies - time and silence." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Amy add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "It is a great danger for everyone when what is shocking changes." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Amy add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "One's life is more formed, I sometimes think, by books than by human beings: it is out of books one learns about love and pain at second hand. Even if we have the happy chance to fall in love, it is because we have been conditioned by what we have read, and if I had never known love at all, perhaps it was because my father's library had not contained the right books." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Amy add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "The more one judges, the less one loves." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Amy add a quote by Honore de Balzac
item.description: "Bureaucracy is a giant mechanism operated by pygmies." -- Honore de Balzac

item.title: Amy add a quote by Michael Lewis
item.description: "The CDO was, in effect, a credit laundering service for the residents of Lower Middle Class America. For Wall Street it was a machine that turned lead into gold." -- Michael Lewis

item.title: Amy add a quote by Michael Lewis
item.description: "On Wall Street, the lawyers play the same role as medics in war: They come in after the shooting is over to clean up the mess." -- Michael Lewis

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
